alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 11 at 6:54PM MST until August 11 at 8:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR COCONINO COUNTY... At 652 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated multiple rounds of heavy rainfall moved through the warned area. Between 1 to 1.75 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.50 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is likely ongoing. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... The Wave, Cottonwood TeePees Trailhead White Pocket Trailhead. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Coyote Wash and Paria River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages. Enhanced risk for violent, life-threatening flash flooding in slot canyons and normally dry washes.Flash floods can come from distant thunderstorms, even with little or no rainfall in the immediate area.
